titleStmt.title: Gädlä Qirqos "Vita of Cyricus" / Täʾamrä Qirqos "Miracles of Cyricus"

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

msItem.title: Gädlä Qirqos "Vita of Cyricus”
msItem.rubric: Names of the protagonists; names of the scribe and donors. 8 lines, divided into four groups of two lines each, in the incipit page of Text I; incipit of Text II. The trinitarian formula throughout Text I. Some important passages in Text I. The first two lines of each miracle in Text II. Elements of the punctuation sign; element of Erhiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 4ra: በስመ፡”…ገድል፡ ወስምዕ፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ወብፁዕ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ወዘእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ወዘካልዓን፡ ፼ወ፲፻፴ወ፬ሰማዕታት፡ እለ፡ ተከለሉ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ እለ፡ እስክንድሮስ፡ መኰንን፡ ወኮነ፡ እንከ፡ ሰደት፡ ዓቢይ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘክርስቶስ፨Fol. 4ra: In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, one God, (this is) the life and the martyrdom of saint and blessed Cyricus ( martyr), and of his mother Julitta and of other 11,134 martyrs who were crowned in the time of the Governor Alexander. And then, there was a big persecution in the church of Christ.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 73vb, l.13: …ወዘንተ፡ ብሂላ፡ ቦአት፡ ውስተ፡ ገነተ፡ ትፍሥሕት፨ ወወሀብዋ፡ ኪዳነ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዘገብረ፡ ተዝካራ፡ ወዘሐነጸ፡ መርጡላ፡ እስከ፡ ፲ወ፭ትውልድ፡ ወገድላኒ፡ ጽሑፍ፡ ምስለ፡ ወልዳ፨ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረታ፡ የሃለ፡ ም[ስለ]፡ ዓመታ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለ[ም]፡ አሜን፨Fol. 73vb, l.13: …And having said this, (she) entered the garden of joy. And the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit gave her the Covenant for the one who made her commemoration and built her sanctuary, until the 15th generation. And her gädl is written with (that of) her son. May her prayer and her blessing be with her servant. For ever and ever, amen.

msItem.title: Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyriacus”
msItem.rubric: Names of the protagonists; names of the scribe and donors. 8 lines, divided into four groups of two lines each, in the incipit page of Text I; incipit of Text II. The trinitarian formula throughout Text I. Some important passages in Text I. The first two lines of each miracle in Text II. Elements of the punctuation sign; element of Erhiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 73va, l. 22 (Miracle 1): በስመ፡”… ንዌጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምሪሁ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ ወለቅዱስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ [fol. 73vb] ቂርቆስ፡ ወልደ፡ ቅድስት፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ በረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ም[ስለ]፡ ገብሩ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨፨ ስምዑ፡ ንንግርክሙ፡ ዘገብረ፡ ተአ[fol. 74ra]ምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ በዕለተ፡ ልደቱ፡ ወነበረ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡…Fol. 73va, l.22 (Miracle 1): In the name of the father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, one God, we start, with the help of the Lord, the book of the miracles of blessed and St. martyr Cyricus, son of St. Julitta. May his blessing be with his servant. For ever and ever, amen. Listen, we will tell you how St. Cyricus made miracles and wonders on the day of his birth. And there was a man who was possessed by a demon...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 94rb, l.2 (Miracle 45): …ወቤቱ፡ ለውእቱ፡ ሠራቂ፡ ውስተ፡ ፩መካን፡ ውእቱ፡ ጥቃ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያኑ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወልደ፡ ቅድስት፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የዓሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብሩ፡ እኁነ፡ ገ[ብ]ረ፡ መድኅን፡ ወለ[ተ]፡ እግዚአ፡ ኃረያ፡ ወምስለ፡ ዓመቱ፡ ወለ[ተ]፡ ማርያም፡ ወምስለ፡ አግብርቲሁ፡ አቡነ፡ ተስፋ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወምስለ፡ ጸሐፊሁ፡ ኀጥእ፡ ወአባሲ፡ ገብረ፡ ሕይወት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፨ አሜን፨ ወአሜን፡ ለይኩን፨ ለይኩን፨Fol. 94rb, l.2 (Miracle 45): …and the house of that thief was in a place near the church of St. Cyricus, son of St. Julitta. May his prayer and his blessing be with his servant, our brother Gäbrä Mädḫǝn, Wälä[tta] ʾƎgziʾu Ḫaräya, with his maid Wälä[tta] Maryam and his servants ʾabunä Täsfay Mikaʾel, and with his scribe, sinful and impious Gäbrä Ḥǝywät. For ever and ever, amen and amen. So be it, so be it.

listBibl.bibl: (EMML II, 4; Church of St. Raphael, quarter of Guläle, Addis Abäba).
(EMML II, 364; Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, Addis Abäba).
(EMML VIII, 283-284; Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yäğğu, Wallo).
(EMML X, 324; Church of Däse Mädḫane ʿAläm, Wallo).

note.p: The list of the miracles are as follows:
II-1) Fols. 74ra (l.2) – 74rb (l.10): St. Cyricus and the man possessed by a demon.
II-2) Fols. 74rb (l.11) – 74va (l.14): St. Cyricus and St. Gabriel.
II-3) Fols. 74va (l. 15) – 75va (l.17): St. Cyricus and Qadi, the infidel man.
II-4) Fols. 75va (l.18) – 76ra (l.24): St. Cyricus and the woman who liked the adultery.
II-5) Fols. 76ra (l.25) – 76vb (l.24): St. Cyricus and the man who had neither clothes no food.
II-6) Fols. 76vb (l.25) – 77va (l.1): St. Cyricus and the man who was making the good.
II-7) Fols. 77va (l.2) – 78ra (l.11): St. Cyricus and the infidel who was a thief.
II-8) Fols. 78ra (l.12) – 78va (l.4): St. Cyricus and the adulteress who "married Ḍaˤada.
II-10) Fols. 79va (l.8) – 79vb (l.10): St. Cyricus and the sick man.
II-11) Fols. 79vb (l.11) – 80ra (l.20): St. Cyricus and the infidel horseman who was adversary of another horseman.
II-12) Fols. 80ra (l.21) – 80vb (l.5): St. Cyricus and the man who loved the love of the world.
II-13) Fols. 80vb (l.6) – 81ra (l.20): St. Cyricus and woman who had no husband.
II-14) Fols. 81ra (l.21) – 82ra (l.4): St. Cyricus and the adulteress with whom no one could be compared in adultery.
II-15) Fols. 82ra (l.5) – 83va (l.5): St. Cyricus and the presbyter.
II-16) Fols. 83va (l.5) – 83vb (l.2): St. Cyricus and the adulterer who separated from his wife.
II-17) Fols. 83vb (l.3) – 84rb (l.20): St. Cyricus receiving his Kidan, in the day of his remembrance.
II-18) Fols. 84rb (l.21) – 84vb (l.27): St. Cyricus and King (Yǝmrǝḥannä Krǝstos) in the region of "Rome".
(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l’enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 33-36 // mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 59v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 28vb-30rb, GrébGriaule II, 4).
II-19) Fols. 85ra (l.1) – 85va (l.5): St. Cyricus and the monk from a remote region.

(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l’enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 85-86, 88-89 // mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 60v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 30rb-31vb, GrébGriaule II, 4-5).
II-20) Fols. 85va (l.6) – 85vb (l.19): St. Cyricus and the sterile couple who was supplicating to the saint for getting a baby.
(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l’enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 86-87, 89-90 // mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 61v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 31vb-32vb, GrébGriaule II, 5).
II-21) Fols. 85vb (l.20) – 86rb (l.11): St. Cyricus and the monk ʾElyas.

(S. Grébaut, “Un noveau recueil des miracles de l’enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 87-91 // mss. EMML no. 3469, fol. 22r, EMML VIII, 283; EMML no. 4816, fol. 62v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 32vb-33vb, GrébGriaule II, 5).
II-22) Fols. 86rb (l.12) – 86va (l.16): St. Cyricus and the man with the impure spirit.
II-23) Fols. 86va (l.17) – 87ra (l.20): St. Cyricus and the paralytic.
II-24) Fols. 87ra (l.21) – 88ra (l.16): St. Cyricus and the Jew.
II-25) Fols. 88ra (l.17) – 88rb (l.12): St. Cyricus and the man from Egypt.
II-26) Fols. 88rb (l.13) – 88va (l.12): St. Cyricus and the man in a region with a building on the insland.
II-27) Fols. 88va (l.13) – 89ra (l.10): St. Cyricus and the bishop who placed in an island of Egypt with his son.
II-28) Fols. 89ra (l.11) – 89rb (l.11): St. Cyricus and the infidel and evil man.
II-29) Fols. 89rb (l.12) – 89va (l.18): St. Cyricus and the pagan woman.
II-30) Fols. 89va (l.19) – 90ra (l.15): St. Cyricus and the man who wanted to take a wife.
II-31) Fols. 90ra (l.16) – 90rb (l.11): St. Cyricus and the bishop.
II-32) Fols. 90rb (l. 12) – 90vb (l.6): St. Cyricus and the big ruler who became king after a lower state.
II-33) Fols. 90vb (l.7) – 90vb (l.26): St. Cyricus and the priests who wanted to restore the church of the saint.
II-34) Fols. 91ra (l.1) – 90ra (l.16): St. Cyricus saved the house of a monk from fire.
II-35) Fols. 91ra (l.17) – 91rb (l.12): St. Cyricus and the pagans who waged a war against Christians.
II-36) Fols. 91rb (l.13) – 91va (l.4): St. Cyricus and the faithful who fell into the precipice.
II-37) Fols. 91va (l.5) – 91vb (l.1): St. Cyricus and the monk who took possession of the image (picture) of the saint.
II-38) Fols. 91vb (l.2) – 92ra (l.6): St. Cyricus and the monk ascetic.
II-39) Fols. 92ra (l.7) – 92ra (l.27): St. Cyricus and the man with a hen.
II-40) Fols. 92rb (l.1) - 92va (l.13): St. Cyricus and construction of a big church in his honour.
II-41) Fols. 92va (l.14) – 92vb (l.21): St. Cyricus and the paralytic who was sick from his childhood.
II-42) Fols. 92vb (l.22) – 93ra (l.19): St. Cyricus and the man whose name was Wäldä Qirqos.
II-43) Fols. 93ra (l.20) – 93rb (l.7): St. Cyricus and the thief who denied stealing.
II-44) Fols. 93rb (l.8) – 93rb (l.25): St. Cyricus and the paralytic whose legs were dry like a stone.
II-45) Fols. 93rb (l.26) – 94rb (l.11): St. Cyricus and the thief who stole the clothes of a woman.
The miracles are not numbered.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 97.0 folios, of which blank 1rv, 2rv, 3rv, 94v, 95rv, 96rv, 97rv, in 13.0 quires .
30.4 23.6 8.3

collation.signatures: Decorated - Decorated quire marks are written in the centre of the upper margin: fols. 12r: ፪, 20r: ፫, 28r: ፬, 36r: ፭, 44r: ፮, 52r: ፯, 60r: ፰, 68r: ፱, 76r: ፲, 84r: ፲፩, 92r: ፲፪.

list.item: 8 ፪II(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 12r-19v)
8 ፭V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 36r-43v)
8 ፲፩XI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 84r-91v)

layout.ab: On average, 24 lines. On different folios, 24-25 lines.
Structural pricks are partly visible (s. fols. 32r, 33r).
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: - Short line with dots above and below (esp. fols. 7rb, l.23; 12va, l.21).
II. - Four dot asterisk (esp. fols. 9ra, l.22; 15va, ls. 8, 22, 23, 24;16ra, l.23; 16rb, l.24; 22ra, l.12; 29vb, l.19; 36rb, l.25; 74rb, l.21).
- Nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text).
- Doubled nine red dot asterisks (esp. 73vb, l.24).
- Nine dot asterisks, connected with lines (esp. fol. 66vb, l.25).

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 73v: simple ornamental band, separating Text I and Text II (geometric motifs).

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, wave form, x-form, cross hatching).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Several names are mentioned in the supplication formula on fol. 94rb: Gäbrä Mädḫǝn, Wälätta ʾƎgziʾ Ḫaräyä, Wälätta Maryam, ʾabunä Täsfa Mikaʾel.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
